title: Why is riots ban system so flawed?
body:
Just want to incite some discussion as I know I'm not the only one who's experienced this.

On multiple occasions I have been banned for negative attitude and/or unsportsmanlike conduct and the like, on this account to the point where it is permanently banned (though not from the forums). More recently, on my newer accounts, I have escaped such punishment by forcing myself not to type when I'm frustrated with my team. It's sad to me that I have to do this, because in reality those games I'd get reported and/or banned for would be pretty mild in terms of "negative attitude." I wasn't one to full blown cuss people out or threaten them or use hate speech or anything like that. Rather, I'd see my teammate facecheck a bush that he knows full well the enemy team is in (because we all just watched them walk in) with 100hp just so he can drop a ward (you know, to show us that the enemies we already know are in the bush are in fact in that bush, just in case there was any doubt), and I'd respond with something like "what the hell was that? you know they're in there... don't facecheck." Pretty reasonable thing to say to a teammate in my opinion. We need to be able to communicate with our team to tell them when they're doing something wrong or right or what have you. That's the whole point of having a chat feature. It doesn't need to get out of hand, but we shouldn't have to be afraid of telling our teammates they're playing poorly because of how they may overreact and report us, and we all know riot will side with them.

I know the majority of you who read my post and actually reply will be the aforementioned face-checker. The insecure, sensitive about my gameplay, and if you insult me I'm running straight down mid type of players. You'll attack my post and say any level of negativity is abusive and should be punishable, and I just want to say up front that I genuinely feel bad for you for being so insecure that you can't take any level of criticism in a video game. The vast majority of players who are on your team are trying to improve and trying to win, and communicating when others are way off base is important and quite helpful when done correctly and properly received. You shouldn't be so quick to the defensive and maybe think to yourself "yea that was pretty dumb, my bad" and move on. When you get offended and start striking back, you're just as bad and the whole situation escalates. But inevitably, the person who gets punished is the one who first said something, and not the person who retaliates.


I've highlighted some of my perceived issues with this rather unforgivable ban-system in the above paragraphs (specifically with respect to in-game chat), and I'm sure many of you can relate and fill in your own gaps as to some of the other details. I intentionally left out chat bans as in my experience these are often skipped and riot is quick to jump to permabans when summoners get frequent reports for negative attitude, even when those reports are mild as in the example described above.


What I want to highlight next is how the people who ACTUALLY ruin the game, i.e. the griefers, are rarely, if ever, punished. Even leavers just get a low-priority queue for a few games and then they're back in action, ready to ruin another ranked game. We even see high elo players complain about this discrepancy in the ban system as well as in recognition among the community (specifically, Super Metroid and Akaadian have tweeted about this very recently). There are players who will intentionally ban the champion you are hovering in champ select just to spite you, then pull out the "I can ban who I want to" card to try and rationalize it (happens to Metroid consistently with another high elo player that doesn't seem to like him very much). There are also people who hard int in game and get away with it by making sure their chat logs show how innocent they are. We have all had hard inters on our team and we all know how this looks compared to someone who has a bad game, so please don't come out with that nonsense to defend it. Then there's the people who pick something troll like teemo support with barrier teleport and aftershock after the jungler doesn't want to roll swap with them, and they get away with ruining the game too. The list can go on, but I'm hoping you get my point.

TAKE HOME MESSAGE:
With respect to chat logs, Riot should focus much more on punishing players who are exceptionally vulgar and obviously out of line rather than those who have a negative attitude because lets face it, not everyone is happy to lose, and you can easily mute someone that is bothering you in chat or via pings. Again, not excusing excessive verbal abuse, hate speech, or threatening statements, but these bans for negativity are excessive and rather unwarranted. People shouldn't have to fear a ban for telling their teammates they're playing poorly. 
With respect to inters, we really need to bring the hammer down on these guys. These are the people who actually ruin games. People who complain and whine about the game in chat are kind of annoying, myself included, but you can mute us if it's tilting you and you can move on. Or you can consider what we have to say and think hm, maybe I shouldn't have facechecked that bush. I'll back off next time. But seriously, inters, leavers, and trolls are what ruin league of legends, and you can mute an inter/troll all you want but they're still going to ruin your game. But what ruins it even more is how much slack they get and how they never go punished, so they keep doing it. Shift the focus away from negativity and onto the people who are actually ruining the in game experience.

replies.body:
While Necromancy may be handy (and sometimes needed) in media, it's not the case for old forum threads. Please avoid using such magic and be mindful of how old threads are before posting.

Feel free to contact us at the [Moderation Discord](https://discordapp.com/channels/230113905668653056/306220435262144512) or at [Discuss the Boards]( https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-moderation) for any questions, comments or concerns about this. Thank you and have a good day.

I don't buy it, and I'm not the kind of person you've pre-disregarded. 

I'm not the face-checker. I'm the bystander. I'm the player off to the side, watching his team cohesion unravel because player A makes a dumb mistake and player B thinks its his job to make a fool out of A. The worst part is when A takes B's ridicule hard, and tilts or starts trolling in retaliation. It sucks, because through no fault of my own, I'm now in a 4v5. Muting sure doesn't help me. I absolutely blame player A for being immature and throwing the game through his actions, but I sure as hell also blame player B for feeling the need to insult his own teammates for no better reason than to feel somehow better about themselves for it.

I also sincerely doubt you've had multiple banned accounts for saying "what the hell was that?".

I'd show you chat logs if I could. But you're pretty ignorant if you want to try and deny that the ban system isn't heavily skewed towards negativity and completely excuses behavior that intentionally ruins games. Getting banned for negativity doesn't have to do with what you say, it's more related to the volume of reports. If you type a lot and tell your team they suck, they're much more likely to dislike you and remember to report you in post-game, even if your behavior technically isn't in violation of the code. But when someone ints and ruins a game sporadically and only receives a few reports here and there for it, they escape the ban system entirely. It's blatantly obvious, and people who are consistently negative or complain and bitch about the game get punished. It might be annoying to listen to, but it's not a bannable violation to be annoying and pessimistic, and you can easily mute me if you so desire. You're missing the picture entirely.

I literally just gave you an example of a situation where your actions would harm my ability to play the game and muting you in no way prevents it. Are you just going to ignore that?

And the punishment system isn't "skewed", it's just infinitely easier to detect chat violations than feeding/trolling. What you consider trolling could easily just be a shitty player or a player having a shitty game, it's really fucking hard to distinguish. Especially in lower ELOs.

>Getting banned for negativity doesn't have to do with what you say, it's more related to the volume of reports. 

You don't read the rules very often, do yah?

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752884-Reporting-a-Player

*Do not ask other players in the match to report the offending player. It only takes one report for our systems to review a game. Additional reports will not do anything for the offending player; however as mentioned above, it could open yourself up to a report of your own; especially if you are derailing the match by constantly demanding reports of other players.*

>It might be annoying to listen to, but it's not a bannable violation to be annoying and pessimistic, and you can easily mute me

It's literally the first box in the report window

**NEGATIVE ATTITUDE**
**Griefing. Giving up**
This is truly the time it is appropriate to ask for chatlogs. Doubt you were punished solely for questioning a stupid decision.

The last two times I had some hard inters on my team, their actions were preceded by someone belittling them. Not with the level of insults you find unacceptable in chat, but the kind I think you would find acceptable. But those are edge cases. 

Most of the time, I ignore players that engage in arguing and insulting commentary, but I don't speak for the entire player base, as others don't always mute problematic players. Muting players solves *my* problem with another's actions, but it doesn't resolve its affects on anyone else. I'm not sensitive to your insults; they're frankly detrimental to my goal of winning, and I don't want them in my game. 

Also, I've rarely seen players with 1 or 2, heck maybe even 3 lines where all they say is get onto a teammate for doing something stupid. It happens. But you don't arrive to a permaban without a history of that happening, and you get punished when your actions are continuously causing a negative effect for the rest of your team.

And as I said in my introductory statement I haven't been banned in a long time, I'm speaking from my experience on this account nearly 6 years ago, that of vocal players in high elo, and that of people I have played with in the long 8 years I've played this game. I see first hand how they act in game and know full well it's not bannable, because I know what it takes to get banned. Yet they get bans anyways, while the inters remain.

I think it's much easier to spot chat toxicity than it is to spot intentional feeding, mostly because they're given the benefit of the doubt. If you feel like someone was intentionally losing a game, but doing it in an obscure way, write a support ticket.

The last 2 intentional feeders I had mentioned haven't played a game recently.

And lastly, the whole point of this post is that focus needs to be shifted on inters. People with negative attitudes are flagged as "toxic" and pull in frequent reports because they annoy people. The ban system is based largely on volume of reports and not necessarily what the reports specifically entail. So if a player is consistently negative and annoys people to the point where they report them for the sake of reporting them, they are much more likely to get banned. Meanwhile, inters get away everything ban-free because (1) they usually don't int every game and (2) it's "harder to prove" because Riot realistically only looks at chat logs, which is unfair. Vods should be reviewed for these kinds of offenses, as it would actually take much less time to fastforward and skim a vod to find evidence of inting than it would to read a full chat log.

> [{quoted}](name=lobstertower,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=EVzbHWhP,comment-id=00040002,timestamp=2018-09-12T01:46:43.719+0000)
>
>  The ban system is based largely on volume of reports and not necessarily what the reports specifically entail. So if a player is consistently negative and annoys people to the point where they report them for the sake of reporting them, they are much more likely to get banned. 

That's not true. It only takes 1 report to trigger a review of one's actions or chat, depending on what was reported.


If you're talking about reports across multiple matches, then yes, you'd be more likely to be punished if you are being negative and being reported across those multiple matches.

The system banner the flamers is not slowing down anything in relation to gameplay deviency. It exists and operates independently and getting rid of or limiting it in some way would not reduce the number of trolls or infers in your game anyway. It would only allow more people to behave aggressively toward others (is this a goal of yours?) Which would INCREASE the number of trolls and inters in your games since some people do so reactionarily rather than premeditatively.

I confess I have intentionally fed exactly once, years ago, and it was to make sure someone who was insulting me lost. This is probably not an isolated case.

> [{quoted}](name=Periscope,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=EVzbHWhP,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2018-09-12T01:33:42.778+0000)
>
> The last two times I had some hard inters on my team, their actions were preceded by someone belittling them. 
I have serious issues with this line. The gap between intentional feeder and flamer of any kind is so wide, that I would be okay with having only flamers in my team if I could have no inters.

I can tolerate anything said in chat and still enjoy the game. I can not enjoy the game when the board is flipped. Words do not justify flipping the board. One thing is mildly bad, but the other one is unforgivable. Linking them is a mistake.

> [{quoted}](name=Mc Truck,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=EVzbHWhP,comment-id=00040003,timestamp=2018-09-12T06:24:07.477+0000)
>
> I have serious issues with this line. The gap between intentional feeder and flamer of any kind is so wide, that I would be okay with having only flamers in my team if I could have no inters.
> 
>  Linking them is a mistake.

You’re right. I guess I get tired of hearing folks say that lesser insults and toxicity shouldn’t be punished, so I offered pretty rare and severe overreactions.

> [{quoted}](name=Periscope,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=EVzbHWhP,comment-id=000400030000,timestamp=2018-09-12T07:09:07.221+0000)
>
> You’re right. I guess I get tired of hearing folks say that lesser insults and toxicity shouldn’t be punished, so I offered pretty rare and severe overreactions.

The question if flamers in videogames should be punished at all(and how severe should those punishments be) has no satisfactory answer and riot's current policy is on the most harsh side of the spectre. In this light original post is very... ambitious. 

But despite being a seasoned facechecker, I can see several valid points in it. I will break them down or write a post of my own, when I reach a decent keyboard. There is no way I am going to work with that wall of text from my phone.
Not against the summoner's code though, so that's your own personal problem. Missing the point yet again.

I wouldnt say so much as its flawed, but it does need some heavy improvement. Its really hard to take this seriously when you arent showing evidence though. You are only giving your side of the story, and sadly that doesnt help much. You cannt say that the only reason you are ban was because you told someone not to facecheck and just have us believe that. Ive been on this board for many years and have seen every excuse in the book. People will always make themselves look better or play the victim. You want us to take you seriously Show your chatlogs. Or show us evidence that what you claim is the only reason you got ban!
I don't need hard evidence it's very prevalent in the community among high elo players, they're pretty vocal about the issue. Trying to raise some awareness on the forums as well.

"I don't need hard evidence to support my claim"

Oh I see how it is... you're the "I said so therefore it's true by default" type, aren't cha?

Have to agree with the joo, I'm highly suspicious that you were perm banned for saying what the hell.

I say way worse and I've never gotten above a 25 game chat restriction.

> [{quoted}](name=lobstertower,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=EVzbHWhP,comment-id=,timestamp=2018-09-11T23:42:26.102+0000)
>
>  You shouldn't be so quick to the defensive and maybe think to yourself "yea that was pretty dumb, my bad" and move on.

Your best case scenario is...that people who died will know that they died....know that it was a bad thing....and then move on.

I'm going to insult you now.

I'm not certain about your cognitive abilities, but most people who are capable of playing League will understand that they have died when their health drops to 0, their screen goes grey and their character doesn't respond to commands even without an observer explicitly mentioning it.

Again, not certain about you, but most people have noticed by now that you can't contribute to winning while dead.

That leaves "move on". Hmm. Is the best way to move on to start talking about every mistake they've ever made, or would it be better to type about the future decisions that could work towards victory. Hell, even just go halfway and don't type anything.

Its actually sad to see this post being down posted. We never really hear about inters and feeders being punished, but we hear about people who curse during games being banned. Lest be honest, without inters, feeders, etc this community wouldn't have to be so frustrated. I too want to always type and flame my teammates cause sometimes you actually feel like they are stupid. You realize that it will get you no where.

[Here](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/iEmuVtpw-banned-for-being-new-at-the-game-and-making-a-mistake) is someone being banned for troll building AP Draven.

[Here](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/7BETXRVw-banned-for-two-week-only-one-int) is someone banned for inting.

[Another](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/EymKjLv3-seriously-riot-i-got-banned-for-feeding-in-nexux-blitz) int feeding case.

[And Another](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/JuAqmbE3-glad-to-see-the-system-working) int feeding ban.

[Oooh!](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/c27gtf8e-why-do-i-get-banned-for-leaving-a-game) someone getting banned for rage quitting. That's an unusual one.
------------------------------
That's the most recent two weeks on the boards.

It's not much, but most of the people who get banned for trolling understand why they were banned, so posting wouldn't make much difference. 

Of the trolls that do post (with a full set of excuses), many will delete their thread if anyone grabs a clip of the replay.

> [{quoted}](name=D4HYUN,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=EVzbHWhP,comment-id=0009,timestamp=2018-09-12T05:59:27.030+0000)
>
> Its actually sad to see this post being down posted. 

Its just classic player behavior boards,just ignore the downvotes

>, and I just want to say up front that I genuinely feel bad for you for being so insecure that you can't take any level of criticism in a video game

Says the guy who feels the need to insult people who aren't like-minded

The lack of self awareness is strong with this one...

{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

>I know the majority of you who read my post and actually reply will be the aforementioned face-checker. The insecure, sensitive about my gameplay, and if you insult me I'm running straight down mid type of players. You'll attack my post and say any level of negativity is abusive and should be punishable,

When your argument needs a baseless claim to back it up...

LoL

> [{quoted}](name=lobstertower,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=EVzbHWhP,comment-id=,timestamp=2018-09-11T23:42:26.102+0000)
>
> Just want to incite some discussion as I know I'm not the only one who's experienced this.
> 
> On multiple occasions I have been banned for negative attitude and/or unsportsmanlike conduct and the like, on this account to the point where it is permanently banned (though not from the forums). More recently, on my newer accounts, I have escaped such punishment by forcing myself not to type when I'm frustrated with my team. It's sad to me that I have to do this, because in reality those games I'd get reported and/or banned for would be pretty mild in terms of "negative attitude." I wasn't one to full blown cuss people out or threaten them or use hate speech or anything like that. Rather, I'd see my teammate facecheck a bush that he knows full well the enemy team is in (because we all just watched them walk in) with 100hp just so he can drop a ward (you know, to show us that the enemies we already know are in the bush are in fact in that bush, just in case there was any doubt), and I'd respond with something like "what the hell was that? you know they're in there... don't facecheck." Pretty reasonable thing to say to a teammate in my opinion. We need to be able to communicate with our team to tell them when they're doing something wrong or right or what have you. That's the whole point of having a chat feature. It doesn't need to get out of hand, but we shouldn't have to be afraid of telling our teammates they're playing poorly because of how they may overreact and report us, and we all know riot will side with them.

Nah,chat can *never* be to tell someone that they fucked up,because it's definently *my* problem if the other person choses to take it personally.

> I know the majority of you who read my post and actually reply will be the aforementioned face-checker. The insecure, sensitive about my gameplay, and if you insult me I'm running straight down mid type of players. You'll attack my post and say any level of negativity is abusive and should be punishable,

Its only in player behavior boards,just ignore it.

> and I just want to say up front that I genuinely feel bad for you for being so insecure that you can't take any level of criticism in a video game. The vast majority of players who are on your team are trying to improve and trying to win, and communicating when others are way off base is important and quite helpful when done correctly and properly received. You shouldn't be so quick to the defensive and maybe think to yourself "yea that was pretty dumb, my bad" and move on. When you get offended and start striking back, you're just as bad and the whole situation escalates. But inevitably, the person who gets punished is the one who first said something, and not the person who retaliates.

Welcome to NA! The most dogshit region in terms of competitivness because of reasons like this!

I know I'm not going to get anywhere because the only people who are vocal on the forums are the people who want to argue. Rarely get people posting to agree with me, but I feel it raises awareness regardless.

So in other words, you only accept comments from people who are part of your echo chamber and everyone who disagrees with you is wrong.

Gotcha!

> [{quoted}](name=Voldymort,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=EVzbHWhP,comment-id=000200000001,timestamp=2018-09-12T05:47:35.813+0000)
>
> So in other words, you only accept comments from people who are part of your echo chamber and everyone who disagrees with you is wrong.

Like that's not the mentality of the entire player behavior boards!!

Nice double standards.

except the player behaviour boards has evidence for their claims. OP doesn't. he's just right because he said so

> [{quoted}](name=lobstertower,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=EVzbHWhP,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2018-09-12T01:39:33.577+0000)
>
> I don't need hard evidence 



{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
Yeah,I think you will have a better time if you posted on general discussion. Its just a giant hive mind in player behaviour,its not even funny
I disagree with you.
I rest my case. G'night everybody.
